definition: to break ground (prior to building sth)/to start building
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: You dare to beard the lion in his den.
sentences.chinese: 你竟敢在太歲頭上動土。

sentences.english: A ground-breaking ceremony of the project was held in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 該工程於當天早上舉行了動土儀式。

sentences.english: Tzu Chi volunteers held a ground-breaking ceremony to celebrate the launch of a village relocation project for Rouli Township residents.
sentences.chinese: 慈濟志工舉辦動土奠基儀式，慶祝若笠鄉遷村計畫。

sentences.english: The increase of dynamic earth pressure in the back of structure provides the movement condition for the structure.
sentences.chinese: 牆後動土壓力的增加爲擋土牆的運動提供了條件。

sentences.english: Groundbreaking animation, special FX and character design and development from Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 來自瑞典的動畫動土，特別FX和人物設計和開發。

definition: to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
Tai Sui, God of the year/archaic name for the planet Jupiter 木星[Mu4 xing1]/nickname for sb who is the most powerful in an area
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
to start using/(computing) to enable (a feature)
